user.biography: What’s it take to create a @natgeo photograph?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Nat Geo in the Field on September 03, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and pool.

node.text:
Photos by @donaldmiralle / Adopted by American parents at the age of 13 months from a Russian foster care, Jessica Long had her lower legs amputated when she was 18 months because of fibular hemimelia. 

Now at 29 years of age, Jessica Long has gone to 5 Paralympics, winning 29 medals, 16 of them gold, making her one of the most successful Paralympians in history. 

Thank you for being such an amazing bright light to all @jessicatatianalong 
Hands down one of the most inspirational  athletes I’ve shot in the last 25 years!

These 10 photos are from Jessica’s last swim tonight in the Women’s S8 100m Butterfly at the @tokyo2020 @paralympics winning her 16th career Paralympic Gold Medal to close out the meet. She won her 1st Paralympic medal when she was 12. Unbelievable…

node.text:
Video by Arturo Rodriguez @arturorguezdotcom / Remo is a Malinois breed dog shepherd which is the perfect partner of Jenifer Santos. It is her bodyguard, her alarm system, her best friend and her workmate. In the Canary Islands, the southernmost region of Spain, the primary sector is going through a terrible crisis due to the Covid-19 pandemic. Thousands of farmers in the country have been waiting for almost one year for public subsidies from Europe, but the response from the continent has been slow. The Canaries are still trying to escape the 2008 economic crisis that hit the region harder than any other place in Spain, with unemployment rates that have risen 35% (25% in 2021). 

This work is supported by the @insidenatgeo COVID-19 Emergency Fund for Journalists. #CanaryIslands #Tenerife #Spain #Covid-19

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Nat Geo in the Field on September 02, 2021. May be an image of 2 people and indoor.

node.text:
Photos by @leeannolwage / Pastor Ndikuhoole Nakamhela (76) and his wife Ngeno (76) met at 15, and have been married for 51 years. In 2013, after retiring to Kalkfeld near the Namibian capital of Windhoek, Ngeno began acting ‘out of context’, with memory lapses and mood changes. The doting Ndikuhoole cared for her as her suspected dementia advanced, but in January 2021 the family employed a day-time carer. This is an ideal model for later-life care, where someone living with dementia-type symptoms is able to age in the familiarity and comfort of their home.
September is Alzheimer’s Awareness Month. Follow @leeannolwage and writer Leonie Joubert @science_scribe as we explore how communities in rural Namibia perceive and treat those living with these brain conditions. #alzheimers #dementia #namibia

node.text:
Photos by @donaldmiralle / Damian Lopez Alfonzo you are amazing. 79.2 km today in heavy rain and fog in the Men’s C1-3 Road Race, Tokyo Paralympics. These Games continue to inspire me…

More stories from some of the World’s most amazing athletes from the @tokyo2020 @paralympics to be posted this week here and on @donaldmiralle 
#paralympics #tokyo2020 #adaptiveathlete #sports

In the Canary Islands, the southernmost region of Spain, the primary sector is going through a terrible crisis due to the Covid-19 pandemic. node.text: Photo by @lynseyaddario / Firefighters try to protect structures on the Echo Summit above the Highway 50 in California on Monday. The Caldor fire continues to rip through the canyons and ridges around the Lake Tahoe basin as firefighters and emergency workers from all over California work to contain the fire and save homes and buildings from destruction.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Nat Geo in the Field on September 01, 2021. May be an image of grass.

node.text: Photo by Ben Depp @deppphoto / Flotsam marks the high water mark on some of the taller levee in Port Sulpher, Louisiana following Hurricane Ida. I’m always drawn to the ways that water and storms and wave energy leave a print on the landscape, kinda like “I was here”. In many buildings in South Louisiana you can find a high water mark from previous floods still printed on the walls. I thinks it’s a helpful reminder to not get too comfortable.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Nat Geo in the Field on September 01, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, indoor and brick wall.

node.text:
Photo by @rubensalgadoescudero / I love my job. Here the writer for this story, @arikiadotcom, finds the most interesting of locations for an interview with activist and nightlife regular, Mehrdad Gharibian. She joined me to interview him and others during a portrait shoot at Berlin’s legendary Wilder Renate nightclub on August 31, 2021. 

Follow me @rubensalgadoescudero to see more of the world through my lens. The above photo was taken in Berlin, Germany on assignment with @natgeo documenting Berlin’s electronic music scene, its importance in society here and how it is and has adapted to the Covid-19 Pandemic.

#berlin #electronicmusic #techno #berlinreboot #wilderrenate

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Nat Geo in the Field on September 01, 2021. May be an image of body of water.

node.text: Photo by Ben Depp @deppphoto / Hurricane damage on Grand Isle following Hurricane Ida. Grand Isle’s levee failed in places. Seeing the impact of this storm while flying over it all has been incredible. It’s heartbreaking to see so many homes and communities totally devastated.

node.text: Photo by @lynseyaddario / A handcrew walks along Highway 50 as they try to contain the fire on both sides of the highway along the mountain last Sunday.

node.text: Photo by lynseyaddario / Firefighters from the El Dorado County Fire Department protect a home as the Caldor Fire approaches the town of Meyers, near South Lake Tahoe, California, on Monday. South Lake Tahoe has been evacuated as the fire moves toward Lake Tahoe with red flag warnings and windy conditions.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Nat Geo in the Field on August 31, 2021. May be an image of fire and outdoors.

node.text: Photo by @lynseyaddario / CALFIRE firefighters work on the Dixie Fire last week, which has already burned more than 730,000 acres across Northern California, and continues to burn outside of Susanville, California.
